alert.note: Alert for Central Beaufort Sea Coast (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued July 09 at 9:30AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Central Beaufort Sea Coast. This includes the cities of Nuiqsut, Prudhoe Bay, Alpine, Deadhorse, And Kuparuk. * WHEN...From this evening through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, streams, and creeks which exit to the Arctic Coast including the Sagavanirktok River and Kuparuk River. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Large rises have been measured along the Sagavanirktok River upstream near the headwaters, which reached near moderate flood stage. Given the heavy rainfall across the headwaters, all rivers draining to the Arctic Coast will see large rises as the crest moves downstream. Creeks, rivers, and streams may rise out of their banks. Low-water crossings may be flooded. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
